original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni de dag bya ba la yang dag par zhugs pas ji skad smras pa bzhin du byed pa yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni rtag tu brtul ba brtan pas lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin no //

translated: Holy beings are devoted to the Dharma because they delight in the joy of the Dharma. Holy beings uphold the holy Dharma because they give up their bodies and lives for it.

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni sems can thams cad dang 'brel bas mi gtong ba yin no //
translated: Holy beings are not abandoned because they are related to all sentient beings.

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni don dam pa'i rjes su 'jug pas nyes pa mthong ba yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni sdig pa'i chos rnams par spangs pas dge ba'i chos la zhugs pa yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni dpul po rnams kyi gter yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi skyabs yin no /

analyzed: kyi rten yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni mun pa mun nag tu zhugs pa rnams kyi snang bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams kyi 'dren pa yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag ni chos smra ba rnams kyi yongs su 'dren pa yin no //
translated: Holy beings are the leaders for those who speak of the Dharma.

translated: Holy beings are free from all the faults of anger, malice, hypocrisy, and the torment of hatred, because they are endowed with the yoga of patience and self-control.

analyzed: de lta bas na skyes bu dam pa dag de 'dra ba'i chos la gnas pas ni ye shes chen po de rtogs par nus so //
translated: Therefore, because holy beings abide in such qualities, they are able to realize that great wisdom.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis smras pa /

analyzed: dbang po rtag tu dga' zhing dgod pa /

analyzed: sbyin pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /

analyzed: tshul khrims nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa / bzod pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /

analyzed: brtson 'grus nam mkha' dang / mtshungs pa /
translated: Their diligence is like space.

original: bsam gtan nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
translated: Their concentration is like space.

original: shes rab nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: shes rab nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
translated: Their wisdom is like space. Thus, they are able to realize omniscience.🔽The bodhisattva Newly Generating the Aspiration to Achieve the Dharma Wheel said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @328b bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo sgyur bas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @328b bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo sgyur bas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Newly Generating the Mind of Awakening said,🔽“The mind of awakening is the wheel of the Dharma.🔽

original: sems bskyed pa gang las bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / lha mi dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag gis dge ba'i phyogs yongs su 'bri bar 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpas mi skyed par bya yi /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gang las bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / lha mi dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag gis dge ba'i phyogs yongs su 'bri bar 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpas mi skyed par bya yi /
translated: Those thoughts that Mara the Wrongdoer finds an occasion in, that do not please the Tathagata, that are not approved of by the gods, and that diminish one's wholesome dharmas, those thoughts the Bodhisattva should not think.

original: sems bskyed pa gang las bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par 'gyur ba dang / lha dag dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag gis dge ba'i phyogs yongs su 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag ni bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gang las bdud sdig can gyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par 'gyur ba dang / lha dag dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag gis dge ba'i phyogs yongs su 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag ni bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Those thoughts that Mara the Wrongdoer does not find an occasion in, that please the Tathagata, that are approved of by the gods, and that do not diminish one's wholesome dharmas, those thoughts the Bodhisattva should think.

original: de de ltar zhugs na sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar zhugs na sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he has thus entered, immediately upon the arising of the thought he turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' des sems bskyed ma thag tu sgyu dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyang ma skyes pa las rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' des sems bskyed ma thag tu sgyu dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyang ma skyes pa las rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: As soon as the bodhisattva generates this mind, he realizes that all phenomena are unborn, because of the non-arising of the condition of objectification and of deception.

original: byang chub ji lta bar chos kyi 'khor lo sgyur ba'ang de bzhin du shes te /
analyzed: byang chub ji lta bar chos kyi 'khor lo sgyur ba'ang de bzhin du shes te /
translated: And he realizes that the enlightenment of the Tathāgatas is also unborn.

original: sems kyi bsam pa'i go cha de dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa'i go cha de dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
translated: And he is able to realize omniscience through these armor-like thoughts.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshig gi rab tu tha dad pa thams cad la spobs pas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshig gi rab tu tha dad pa thams cad la spobs pas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Sarva­nirhāradhvaja said,

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: “Good sirs,

original: byang chub ni @329a *//
analyzed: byang chub ni @329a *//
translated: enlightenment

original: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ste /
translated: is the totality of all.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rjes su song ba /🔽rnam par byang ba'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rjes su song ba / rnam par byang ba'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is the totality of the afflictive emotions.🔽It is the totality of purification.

original: 'dus byas kyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rjes su song ba /
translated: It is the totality of the compounded.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi rjes su song ba /
translated: It is the totality of the uncompounded.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with what is defiled.

original: zag pa med pa'i rjes su song ba /🔽kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rjes su song ba / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with what is undefiled.🔽It is in accord with what is reprehensible.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with what is irreproachable.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with the roots of virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rjes su song ba /🔽'jig rten gyi chos kyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rjes su song ba / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with the roots of nonvirtue.🔽It is in accord with worldly dharmas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with supramundane dharmas.

original: 'khor ba'i rjes su song ba /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rjes su song ba / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with saṃsāra.🔽It is in accord with nirvāṇa.

original: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is in accord with annihilation and permanence.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi rjes su song ba ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi rjes su song ba ste /
translated: It is in accord with the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: “Good sirs,

original: byang chub ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'i rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'i rjes su song ba'o //
translated: awakening is in accord with earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin te /
translated: All dharmas have such a nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de dag ni brjod pa gang dang / gang gis brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa de thams cad stong pa nyid smos par byed pa'o; ;'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag ni brjod pa gang dang / gang gis brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa de thams cad stong pa nyid smos par byed pa'o; ;'di lta ste /
translated: All those expressions and the means of expression are empty.

original: dper na / nam mkha'i dbyings ni thams cad kyi rjes su song ngo //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha'i dbyings ni thams cad kyi rjes su song ngo //
translated: For example, the realm of space pervades everywhere.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyang thams cad kyi rjes su song ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyang thams cad kyi rjes su song ste /
translated: In the same way, awakening pervades everywhere.

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: “O noble sirs,

original: @329b byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i ye shes la mos pa ni dmigs pa thams cad la spobs pa 'byung zhing de ni tshig gi rab tu tha dad pa shes pa thams cad kyang thob par 'gyur te; tshul gcig la 'jug pa des thams cad mkhyen pa
analyzed: @329b byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i ye shes la mos pa ni dmigs pa thams cad la spobs pa 'byung zhing de ni tshig gi rab tu tha dad pa shes pa thams cad kyang thob par 'gyur te; tshul gcig la 'jug pa des thams cad mkhyen pa
translated: bodhisattvas who are inspired by such wisdom will have eloquence with regard to all objects of meditation. They will attain all the different kinds of knowledge of words. By engaging in a single method, they will attain omniscience.

original: rtogs so // byang chub sems dpa' spobs pa'i phung pos smras pa /
analyzed: rtogs so // byang chub sems dpa' spobs pa'i phung pos smras pa /
translated: ” The bodhisattva Skill in Means said,

original: kye grogs po dag /🔽brjod pa thams cad ni brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag / brjod pa thams cad ni brjod du med pa ste /
translated: “O friends,🔽all expressions are inexpressible.

original: sgra thams cad bsnyad du med pa'o //
analyzed: sgra thams cad bsnyad du med pa'o //
translated: All sounds are beyond description.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de la mos pa ni sems mi g-yo bar 'dug pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de la mos pa ni sems mi g-yo bar 'dug pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is intent on that wisdom is one whose mind remains unmoved.

original: snyan par smras pa dang / mi snyan par smras pa la dga' ba dang / zhum pa med do //
analyzed: snyan par smras pa dang / mi snyan par smras pa la dga' ba dang / zhum pa med do //
translated: He is neither pleased by pleasant speech nor discouraged by unpleasant speech.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / ri lhun po'i phung po la rlung bab pa las slar log na ri lhun po ni g-yo ba'ang med /
analyzed: dper na / ri lhun po'i phung po la rlung bab pa las slar log na ri lhun po ni g-yo ba'ang med /
translated: When the wind blows against the mass of Mount Meru, it does not move,

original: rab tu g-yo ba'ang med do //
analyzed: rab tu g-yo ba'ang med do //
translated: nor does it shake.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de 'dra ba'i ye shes rtogs pas thams cad kyi sgra dang / brjod pa kun bzod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de 'dra ba'i ye shes rtogs pas thams cad kyi sgra dang / brjod pa kun bzod de /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva who has realized that kind of wisdom endures all sounds and expressions.

original: g-yo bar mi byed /
analyzed: g-yo bar mi byed /
translated: He does not move,

original: rab tu g-yo bar mi byed cing pha rol mu stegs can gyi smra ba gang la'ang chags par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rab tu g-yo bar mi byed cing pha rol mu stegs can gyi smra ba gang la'ang chags par mi 'gyur /
translated: nor does he shake. He is not attached to any of the statements of the opponents, the tīrthikas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang / mu stegs can gyi tshig kyang chos mnyam pa nyid du mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang / mu stegs can gyi tshig kyang chos mnyam pa nyid du mthong /
translated: He sees the words of the tīrthikas and the words of the Tathāgata as the same in terms of the sameness of phenomena.

original: mnyam pa nyid la'ang 'gal bar mi byed /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la'ang 'gal bar mi byed /
translated: He does not contradict sameness.

original: mu stegs can thams cad kyi spobs pa thams cad kyang zad pa'i chos su mthong /
analyzed: mu stegs can thams cad kyi spobs pa thams cad kyang zad pa'i chos su mthong /
translated: He sees the exhaustion of all the confidence of all the tīrthikas.

original: zad pa'i chos kyis chos la nga rgyal chen por yang mi byed @330a *//
analyzed: zad pa'i chos kyis chos la nga rgyal chen por yang mi byed @330a *//
translated: He does not become proud about the Dharma because of the exhaustion of the Dharma.

original: de; skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: de; skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: “Noble ones,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de 'dra ba'i ye shes la mos pa ni myur du thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de 'dra ba'i ye shes la mos pa ni myur du thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the bodhisattvas who have that kind of aspiration for wisdom will quickly attain omniscience.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rgya mtshos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rgya mtshos smras pa /
translated: Sāgaramati Bodhisattva said,

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: “Noble ones,

original: byang chub sems dpas thos pa thams cad bzung ba'i phyir blo gros rgya mtsho la sems 'jug pa rtogs par bya'o; ;chos nyid la sna tshogs med pa'i phyir des chos ro gcig pa la mos par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas thos pa thams cad bzung ba'i phyir blo gros rgya mtsho la sems 'jug pa rtogs par bya'o; ;chos nyid la sna tshogs med pa'i phyir des chos ro gcig pa la mos par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas should understand that the mind that enters the ocean of wisdom is in order to retain all that is heard. They should aspire to the single taste of the Dharma because the nature of phenomena is not a variety.”

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir des chos nyid la brtag par bya'o; ;thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos gang yang ma bri ba dang / ma 'phel bar bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir des chos nyid la brtag par bya'o; ;thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos gang yang ma bri ba dang / ma 'phel bar bya'o //
translated: One should investigate reality by means of dependent origination, because it is not in contradiction with it. One should not diminish or increase any dharma, because it is originally unborn.

original: bsod nams mi zad pa'i phyir sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams mi zad pa'i phyir sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate the roots of virtue that sustain all sentient beings, because of the inexhaustibility of merit.

original: chad pa dang / rtag pa las dben pa'i phyir des mtha' gnyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang / rtag pa las dben pa'i phyir des mtha' gnyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the two extremes by means of that, because of being isolated from annihilation and permanence.

original: sems kyi sgom pa tshad med pa'i phyir des chos thams cad la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sgom pa tshad med pa'i phyir des chos thams cad la brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate all dharmas by means of that, because of the immeasurability of mental cultivation.

original: chos yang dag par mi brjed pa'i phyir bdag gi dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa'ang yongs su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: chos yang dag par mi brjed pa'i phyir bdag gi dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa'ang yongs su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should also establish the generation of the power of one’s own mindfulness, because of the non-forgetfulness of the Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la snyoms par chos 'chad pa'i phyir des snyems pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snyoms par chos 'chad pa'i phyir des snyems pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: One should perfect the complete destruction of all conceit by means of that, because of teaching the Dharma equally to all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa lhur byed pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i chos thams @330b cad dang mi 'grogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa lhur byed pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i chos thams @330b cad dang mi 'grogs par bya'o //
translated: In order to be intent on the unshared qualities of the Buddha, one should not associate with any nonvirtuous qualities.

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: “Noble sirs,

original: dran pa'i ye shes kyi go cha des ni thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: dran pa'i ye shes kyi go cha des ni thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
translated: with this armor of the wisdom of mindfulness, one is able to realize omniscience.🔽”

original: byang chub sems dpa' lhun po chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lhun po chen pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Mahāmeru said,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes de ni 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes de ni 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha is a wisdom that is superior to all worlds.

original: de ni tshad yod pa'i spyod pas rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni tshad yod pa'i spyod pas rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be realized by a limited practice.

original: de bas na bsam pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / thos pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / dad pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / sbyin pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na bsam pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / thos pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / dad pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / sbyin pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang /
translated: Therefore, one’s intention should be superior to all worlds, one’s learning should be superior to all worlds, one’s faith should be superior to all worlds, one’s generosity should be superior to all worlds,

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / bsod nams ri rab lhun po bzhin du mngon par 'phags pas thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / bsod nams ri rab lhun po bzhin du mngon par 'phags pas thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so //
translated: In the same way, morality, patience, perseverance, meditation, and wisdom are exalted above the whole world, and merit is exalted like Mount Meru, so that one is able to realize omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthong na dga' bas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthong na dga' bas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Priyadarśana declared,

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /
translated: “Good sirs,

original: gang gi tshe na byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi gzugs kyi sems yongs su dag pas gzugs su snang ba yid du mi 'ong ba gang yang mig gis mthong zhing snang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi gzugs kyi sems yongs su dag pas gzugs su snang ba yid du mi 'ong ba gang yang mig gis mthong zhing snang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: when the bodhisattva’s mind of form is pure, nothing that appears as form is unpleasant to the eye.

original: bdag gi rna ba'i sems yongs su dag pas sgra yid du mi 'ong ba gang yang rna bas thos @331a *//🔽shing grag par mi 'gyur /🔽de bzhin du dri'ang ma yin /🔽ro'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag gi rna ba'i sems yongs su dag pas sgra yid du mi 'ong ba gang yang rna bas thos @331a *// shing grag par mi 'gyur / de bzhin du dri'ang ma yin / ro'ang ma yin /
translated: When the bodhisattva’s mind of hearing is pure, nothing that appears as sound is unpleasant to the ear.🔽Nothing that appears as smell is unpleasant to the nose.

original: reg kyang ma yin /
analyzed: reg kyang ma yin /
translated: Nothing that appears as taste is unpleasant to the tongue.🔽Nothing that appears as touch is unpleasant to the body.

original: rang gi yul gyi sems yongs su dag pas chos yid du mi 'ong ba gang yang yid la snang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi sems yongs su dag pas chos yid du mi 'ong ba gang yang yid la snang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Because their own minds are completely pure, they do not perceive anything unpleasant.

original: rang gi sems yongs su dag pas yid dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / ma 'brel cing sems can gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod ma yin par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems yongs su dag pas yid dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / ma 'brel cing sems can gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod ma yin par ma mthong ste /
translated: Because their own minds are completely pure, they do not see any sentient beings who are not vessels for the Buddha’s teachings.

original: gang log par nges pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod du 'gyur bar mthong zhing /
analyzed: gang log par nges pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod du 'gyur bar mthong zhing /
translated: They see that even those who are destined for the lower realms will become vessels for the Buddha’s teachings.

original: gang bdag shin tu dga' gyur pa'i dngos po de dga' zhing yongs su gtong la byin nas kyang mi 'gyod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang bdag shin tu dga' gyur pa'i dngos po de dga' zhing yongs su gtong la byin nas kyang mi 'gyod pa yin te /
translated: They give away with joy and without regret anything that brings them joy.🔽A bodhisattva who practices in this way is able to realize omniscience.”

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so; ;byang chub sems dpa' rab tu dga' ba'i rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus so; ;byang chub sems dpa' rab tu dga' ba'i rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Pramuditarāja said:

original: gang gi tshe na spyos pa dang / brgyad pa dang / smad pa dang / brnyas pa dang / brdegs pa dang / tshar bcad na byang chub sems dpa' rab tu dga' ba bskyed cing gang zag de la'ang dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes skyed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na spyos pa dang / brgyad pa dang / smad pa dang / brnyas pa dang / brdegs pa dang / tshar bcad na byang chub sems dpa' rab tu dga' ba bskyed cing gang zag de la'ang dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes skyed la /
translated: When they are scolded, beaten, insulted, disparaged, struck, or harmed, bodhisattvas feel joy and think of those people as spiritual teachers.

original: bzod par byed /
analyzed: bzod par byed /

analyzed: stong gsum rin po ches bkang bas dga' ba ma yin gyi /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas rab tu dga' ba yin te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang de ltar tshad med pa /

translated: If even the highest, complete enlightenment is so difficult to attain, how could we possibly train in this training?🔽We will attain complete nirvāṇa through the vehicle of the śrāvakas,

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam mo //

analyzed: kye ma'o lha'i bu 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @342b byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i skal pa yod do zhes lha'i bu de dag gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir 'khor gyi phyi rol tu khyim bdag gcig mngon par sprul nas khyim bdag

analyzed: de nas khyim bdag de bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /

analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa stan las langs te /

analyzed: zhal zas 'di las bdag la ma stsal bar gsol na ni bcom ldan 'das byas pa gzo ba mi mdzad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas lhung bzed de 'og gi phyogs kyi cha sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'das nas 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od zer

translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: khyod kyis lhung bzed de tshol cig / de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos ting nge 'dzin stong phrag bcu la zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / bdag gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis 'og gi phyogs kyi cha sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong phrag bcur song yang lhung bzed de'i gnas sam /

original: gzhi'ang ma mthong nas /
analyzed: gzhi'ang ma mthong nas /

translated: Having sat down, he said this to the Blessed One:

translated: Venerable Subhūti,🔽when I attain awakening, I will be like Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.🔽I will not know how to take a single step, thinking, 'How do bodhisattva mahāsattvas like Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, walk?

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen po ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin pa de dag mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has entered the Bodhisattva Canon does not see anything that is not a buddha-dharma.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ma yin pa de dag mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ma yin pa de dag mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see anything that is not a bodhisattva training.

original: gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos de dag mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos de dag mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see any dharmas that are not to be trained in by the bodhisattva training.

original: gang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i chos de dag mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i chos de dag mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any dharmas that are not in accord with reality.

original: chos thams cad tshul bzhin du mthong bas chos gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos su mi brjod pa med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad tshul bzhin du mthong bas chos gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos su mi brjod pa med do //
translated: Because he sees all dharmas in accord with reality, there is no dharma that is not called a buddha-dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of noble family!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni yi ges bshad pa mtha' yas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni yi ges bshad pa mtha' yas te /
translated: The Bodhisattva Canon is explained with limitless letters.

original: yi ge'i 'bru gzhag pa tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru gzhag pa tshad med pa yin no //
translated: It is the placement of limitless letters.

original: snang bas gsal ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: snang bas gsal ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: It is the inconceivable illumination of light.

original: de ltar mos pa ni sems can rnams la mnyam pa nyid du gzhug pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen @372a *//
analyzed: de ltar mos pa ni sems can rnams la mnyam pa nyid du gzhug pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen @372a *//
translated: In this way, one should be impartial toward all sentient beings.🔽

original: pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, devotion is the attainment of the wisdom of omniscience in order to enter into the sameness of all sentient beings.

original: gang dag bslab pa de la slob cing slob par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod 'di nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pas theg pa chen po de rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag bslab pa de la slob cing slob par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod 'di nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pas theg pa chen po de rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: All those who train in that training and will train are followers of this very Bodhisattva Collection, and so they will realize that Great Vehicle,

original: de'ang byed pa med par rtogs so //
analyzed: de'ang byed pa med par rtogs so //
translated: and they will realize it without activity.

original: de lta ste /
analyzed: de lta ste /
translated: Thus,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mtshan mo'i thun par ma'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mtshan mo'i thun par ma'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rgya cher bshad do //
translated: at the time of the last watch of the night, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta extensively explained to those bodhisattvas this Dharma discourse of the Bodhisattva Collection.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mtshan mo thun tha ma'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de dag la phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo rdo rje'i tshig la 'jug pa'i don rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mtshan mo thun tha ma'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de dag la phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo rdo rje'i tshig la 'jug pa'i don rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: Then, in the last watch of the night, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta extensively explained to those bodhisattvas the meaning of the words of the vajra wheel of irreversibility.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de chos 'chad pa las sems can gang dag gis chos 'chad pa de mnyan nas de dag thams cad kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i chos nyid rtogs shing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de chos 'chad pa las sems can gang dag gis chos 'chad pa de mnyan nas de dag thams cad kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i chos nyid rtogs shing /
translated: the so-called wheel of irreversibility is as follows: When those bodhisattvas teach the Dharma, any sentient beings who listen to that teaching will all realize the nature of irreversibility.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bshad pa las slar mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo bshad pa las slar mi ldog pa'o //
translated: They will not turn back from the explanation of the wheel of irreversibility.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can sna tshogs su mi spyod /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can sna tshogs su mi spyod /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who aspire to the wheel of irreversibility do not engage in various sentient beings,🔽do not engage in various phenomena,

original: chos sna tshogs su mi spyod; theg pa sna tshogs su mi spyod /
analyzed: chos sna tshogs su mi spyod; theg pa sna tshogs su mi spyod /
translated: do not engage in various vehicles,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su mi spyod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su mi spyod /
translated: and do not engage in various buddha realms.

original: sangs rgyas sna tshogs su mi spyod cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sna tshogs su mi spyod cing /
translated: “They do not engage with the various buddhas,

original: chos thams cad kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni thams cad kyi rjes @372b su zhugs par mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni thams cad kyi rjes @372b su zhugs par mthong ste /
translated: but they see the turning of the wheel of the Dharma of all phenomena as engaging with everything.

original: chos kyi dbyings tha dad par yang chos kyi 'khor lo de mi bskor te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings tha dad par yang chos kyi 'khor lo de mi bskor te /
translated: That wheel of Dharma is not turned in the realm of phenomena that is separate.

original: de bas na phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the irreversible wheel.

original: 'khor lo de ni yongs su ma chad pa'i 'khor lo'o; ;gnyis su med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni yongs su ma chad pa'i 'khor lo'o; ;gnyis su med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: That wheel is the unbroken wheel, the nondual wheel,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: the wheel of the expression of the way things are,

original: rang byung ba'i ye shes rtogs pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rang byung ba'i ye shes rtogs pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: and the wheel of the realization of self-arisen wisdom.🔽That wheel is the wheel of the maṇḍala of the realm of phenomena.

original: 'khor lo de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o; ;rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o; ;rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen po gang dag mtshan ma thams cad kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo 'di la mos par 'gyur pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / mos par 'gyur ba de thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol bas rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen po gang dag mtshan ma thams cad kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo 'di la mos par 'gyur pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / mos par 'gyur ba de thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol bas rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have faith in this wheel that is irreversible due to all signs, who are causing faith, and who will have faith, will all be liberated by the liberation of the tathāgatas.

original: rnam par grol ba ni gnyis su'ang mi ston to //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni gnyis su'ang mi ston to //
translated: Liberation is not taught as being dual.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang de yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang de yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the liberation of the tathāgatas is also the characteristic of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The liberation of the tathāgatas is without characteristics.

original: chos thams cad kyang rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin te /
translated: All phenomena are also free from the characteristic of liberation.

original: chos gang mtshan nyid med pa de ni rnam par grol ba'ang med mod kyi /
analyzed: chos gang mtshan nyid med pa de ni rnam par grol ba'ang med mod kyi /
translated: That which is without characteristics is also without liberation.

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: It is nondual,

original: sems dang / lus dang bral ba de ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang / lus dang bral ba de ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: free from mind and body, and that is liberation.”

original: gang sems dang / gang lus de ni rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang sems dang / gang lus de ni rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind and the body are not liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par grol ba de sems dang / lus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de sems dang / lus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because liberation is the nature of the mind and the body.

original: de lta bas @373a *//
analyzed: de lta bas @373a *//
translated: Therefore,

original: na ye shes de gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir /
analyzed: na ye shes de gzhan la rag ma las pa'i phyir /
translated: because that wisdom is not dependent on anything else,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the irreversible wheel.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: gzhan yang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo ni slar mi ldog go /
analyzed: gzhan yang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo ni slar mi ldog go /
translated: furthermore, the irreversible wheel does not turn back.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin las mi ldog go /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin las mi ldog go /
translated: Form does not turn back from the nature of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin las mi ldog go /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin las mi ldog go /
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness do not turn back from the nature of consciousness.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of noble family,

original: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings de las mi ldog ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings de las mi ldog ste /
translated: all phenomena do not turn back from the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings de ni ji lta ba bzhin yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de ni ji lta ba bzhin yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: Because that realm of phenomena is as it is, it is called the irreversible wheel.”

original: 'khor lo de ni dbus su 'jug pa'ang med de /
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni dbus su 'jug pa'ang med de /
translated: That wheel does not enter into the center.

original: 'khor lo de ni tshad pa med pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni tshad pa med pa /
translated: That wheel is immeasurable.

original: rtag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not permanent.

original: de la ni sgo cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de la ni sgo cung zad kyang med de /
translated: It has no door at all.

original: de ni gnyis su med pa'i sgo'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med pa'i sgo'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of the nondual door.

original: 'khor lo de ni skor ba med de /
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni skor ba med de /
translated: That wheel does not turn.

original: mi skor ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: mi skor ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of non-turning.

original: 'khor lo de ni ston pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni ston pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: That wheel does not teach anything at all.

original: mi brjod pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: mi brjod pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of non-expression.

original: 'khor lo de ni sgrogs pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni sgrogs pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: That wheel does not proclaim anything at all.

original: brjod du med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of the inexpressible.

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo de ni stong pa nyid kyi sgo la gnas pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo de ni stong pa nyid kyi sgo la gnas pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that irreversible wheel is signless because it abides in the door of emptiness.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sgo la gnas pas mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sgo la gnas pas mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: It is without characteristics because it abides in the door of liberation.

original: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It has the characteristic of space, which pervades everything.

original: de'ang de'i rjes su yang dag par song ba'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de'ang de'i rjes su yang dag par song ba'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: It is the nature that has gone to that.

original: de bas na phyir @373b mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phyir @373b mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the irreversible wheel.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: rdo rje'i tshig ni gang chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig ni gang chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa'o //
translated: the vajra words are the realization of all phenomena.

original: yang chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the realization of all phenomena?

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of noble family,

original: stong pa nyid ni rdo rje'i tshig ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rdo rje'i tshig ste /
translated: emptiness is a vajra word,

original: lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad nges par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad nges par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: for it leads to the realization of all views.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of noble family,

original: mtshan ma med pa ni rdo rje'i tshig ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni rdo rje'i tshig ste /
translated: signlessness is a vajra word,

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for it leads to the transcendence of all conceptual thoughts.
